meanings.definition: To organize or arrange something in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: She is resystematizing her closet to make more space for her clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company is resystematizing its workflow to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: John decided to start resystematizing his sock drawer, much to the amusement of his friends.
meanings.sent4: By resystematizing the project timeline, we can ensure better coordination among team members.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's method of resystematizing the lesson made it easier for the students to understand.

meanings.definition: The act of restructuring or reorganizing a system.
meanings.sent1: The resystematizing of the department's processes led to increased productivity.
meanings.sent2: After the resystematizing of the library catalog, finding books became much easier.
meanings.sent3: The resystematizing of the school cafeteria menu brought some unexpected but welcome changes.
meanings.sent4: The resystematizing of the city's public transportation system was a massive undertaking.
meanings.sent5: The resystematizing of the computer network resulted in faster data transfer speeds.
